deck: American movie and television actress who has portrayed the warrior Sif in the Thor movies.
description:
Biography

Jaimie Alexander was born in South Carolina, USA on March 12, 1984. The only girl with four brothers, she is a self described comic book nerd and fan citing her brothers as the reason. She is especially fond of Marvel comic characters X-23, Gambit and Sif.

Acting Profile

Despite being kicked out of theater class in high school for not being able to sing, Alexander would always harbor an interest in acting. Alexanders acting break out role came in The Other Side where she was unexpectedly cast for the leading role after initially helping out with male actors scripting readings. She has appeared in various television shows such as Kyle XY and It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, before given her relatively first big role in Marvels Thor.

Comic Related Movie Roles

Sif

Alexander portrays the warrior Lady Sif in both 2011's Thor and 2013's Thor: The Dark World alongside actors Idris Elba and Natalie Portman. A fan of the Sif she talks about her future as the character "I loved playing Sif. She's definitely one of my favorite characters I've ever taken on, and I would be delighted to be in more Marvel films playing her. It was such good experience that I could only wish to do that again, and I think there's a strong possibility that that could happen. Fingers crossed." prior to the announcement of Thor: Dark World. Alexander would also undergo a physical transformation to fit the role of the warrior goddess explaining that the part required hours a day in the gym.
name: Jaimie Alexander

deck: Japanese actor whose work includes Thor and Thor: The Dark World.
description:
Biography

Tadanobu Satō also known as Tadanobu Asano was born in Yokohama, Kanagawa, Japan on the 27th of November 1973.

Acting Profile

Primarily works in Japanese movies and television shows, Asano also had starring role in Mongol (2007) as well as reaching a greater audience as the grim disposed Hogun in Marvels Thor franchise.

Comic Related Movie Roles

Hogun

Asano portrays the Warriors Three character Hogun the grim in both Thor movies, Thor (2011) and Thor: The Dark World (2013) alongside Ray Stevenson, Joshua Dallas and Zachary Levi, fellow Warriors Three actors.
name: Tadanobu Asano

deck: German/Irish actor, starring in such movies as Inglourious Basterds, and the X-Men franchise, where he portrays a young Magneto.
description:
Biography

Michael Fassbender was born in Heidelberg, Baden-Württemberg, Germany on the 2 of April 1977 to an Irish mother and German father.

Stelios

Fassbender plays the Spartan warrior Stelios in the 2007 film 300, directed by Zack Snyder and based on the Frank Miller series of the same name.

Magneto

In 2011, Fassbender played Erik Lehnsherr, who becomes mutant extremist Magneto in the Matthew Vaughn-directed film, X-Men: First Class. He reprised his role in the 2014 sequel, X-Men: Days of Future Past, and is reportedly set to return in X-Men: Apocalypse.

description:
Biography

Olivia Wilde was born in New York, on March 10, 1984. Professing to always wanting to be an actor since the age of two, her parents career meant she would meet a lot of famous and powerful figures in her childhood, and would even count famous writer and atheist Christopher Hitchens as her baby sitter.

Acting Profile

Wilde would appear in several television shows such as The O.C as Alex Kelly, as well as medical drama House MD as Thirteen.

Quorra

Ella Swenson

Baroness

Wilde would appear as Baroness in The Ballad of G.I. Joe.

deck: Scottish actor whose movie work include X-Men: First Class and Wanted.
description:
Comic Related Roles

Wesley Gibson

James McAvoy starred alongside Angelina Jolie and Morgan Freeman in the 2008 movie, Wanted. The movie was loosely based upon the Mark Millar comic of the same name. Changes to the source material include making the character of Wesley Gibson more heroic and losing the masked guise of The Killer.

Charles Xavier

In the 2011 Matthew Vaughn directed movie, X-Men: First Class, McAvoy portrayed a younger rendition of Charles Xavier. The movie chronicles the early days of the X-Men-- Focusing on the formation of the team, the rise of Sebastian Shaw's Hellfire Club, and the friendship between Xavier and Magneto in the early 1960's.

McAvoy reprises his role in the Bryan Singer-helmed X-Men: Days of Future Past, loosely based on the Chris Claremont-written story arc of the same name.
name: James McAvoy

deck: American actress whose movie roles include X2 and The Scorpion King.
description:
Biography

Kelly Hu was born in Honolulu, Hawaii, U.S. on February 13, 1968. The winner of various Miss USA pageants and a keen martial artist.

Acting Profile

Hu has acted in a variety of television and movie roles, including Cradle 2 the Grave and The Scorpion King.

Recently she plays a role as the villain China White in the comic book based TV show Arrow.

Hu is also notable for her voice acting role in comic book based animated show Young Justice in her role as Cheshire.

Comic Related Movie Roles

Lady Deathstrike

Hu appears in X2: X-Men United (2003) as Yuriko Oyama also known as Lady Deathstrike.

deck: English actor whose work includes Thor, Thor: The Dark World, The Losers and Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance.
description:
Biography

Idris Elba, also Idrissa Akuna Elba before shortening it, was born in England on the 6th of September in 1972. He would go on to be a television, stage and movie actor.

Acting Profile

Working out of both England and America Elba's acting roles include a variety of small roles from both countries, starting out acting in shows such as Bramwell and Dangerfield before pursing acting roles in the US. Eventually Elba would land a starring role in The Wire, before going on to appear in such movies as

Comic Related Movie Roles

Roque

Elba plays Cpt. William Roque in the Losers (2010) movie.

Heimdall

Elba appears as the Asgardian sentry of the bifrost bridge Heimdall in both of the Thor movies, Thor (2011) and Thor: The Dark World (2013) and his role would gain minor controversy, with many questioning the decision to have a black man play a nordic god. Such criticism was largely dismissed by Elba as being ridiculous, with similar sentiment echoed by his costars, such as Jaimie Alexander. In what many criticized as an attempt to force more diversity into the film most likely just being a result of Kenneth Branagh's habit of color blind casting.

Moreau

Elba would appear in the 2012 Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance movie playing Moreau.
name: Idris Elba

deck: An actor famous for playing Bruce Banner/Hulk in The Avengers - taking over the  role from Ed Norton.
description:
Comic Related Movie Roles

Bruce Banner/Hulk

Ruffalo's first comic book movie was in the massively popular The Avengers in which he played Bruce Banner and the Hulk. Ruffalo took over the role from Ed Norton who had been in Hulk's previous Marvel Cinematic Universe film The Incredible Hulk. He is notable for being the first actor to be both Bruce and Hulk - through the use of CGI.
name: Mark Ruffalo

deck: English actor who is best known as billionaire superhero Bruce Wayne/Batman in Christopher Nolan's Batman Trilogy.
description:
Biography

Christian Bale was born in Haverfordwest, Pembrokeshire, Wales and started his acting career at the age of 8 in 1982, when he starred in a fabric softener commercial. From there he went into stage acting and landed a role alongside renowned actor Rowan Atkinson. Bale's career begun to take off some years later after receiving praise for his role as Jim Graham in Empire of the Sun.

Bale continued to display his wide range of acting talent by starring in various small and large stage, film, and voice productions, which eventually brought him to the attention of Christopher Nolan's who chose him to be the lead role in his Batman reboot.

Acting Profile

Christian Bale is the very definition of a character actor and someone who completely melds himself into whatever character he is currently playing. This is no more evident than when Bale played the character Trevor Reznik in The Machinist, this role saw Bale lose over 60 pounds, develop a harmful diet (of only coffee and apples) and sleeping patterns (going days without sleeping), in order to devote himself to the character.

Bale's commitment to his roles was also obvious when he gained 100 lbs to accurately play the part of Batman, going from around 130 lbs to 230 lbs in just under six months time.

Comic Related Movie Roles

Bruce Wayne/Batman

Christian's Bale's most well known role was as the billionaire Bruce Wayne and his superhero identity Batman, in Christopher Nolan's live action Batman Trilogy reboot. Bale appeared as Bruce Wayne/Batman in all three films, Batman Begins, The Dark Knight, and The Dark Knight Rises.
name: Christian Bale

He played Lt. Eckhardt in the movie Batman.

deck: An American born actor, producer, screenwriter, and singer-songwriter, who is more famously known for his role as billionaire Tony Stark in various Marvel movies, including the Iron Man trilogy, and the Avengers.
description:
Biography

Robert Downey Jr. was born in New York, New York, USA and taking after his parents, Robert Downey Sr. and Elsie Ford, his acting career began at the age of 5, when he appeared in one of his father's movies. Downey Jr's career then started to blossom as he landed multiple theater roles which garnered critical acclaim and served to elevate his career. Due to his new found popularity Downey was asked to join the cast of a younger and newer Saturday Night Live (SNL); however, he only lasted one year due to poor viewership ratings.

Following his departure from SNL, Downey Jr. had what was considered the first breakthrough of his career when he starred in Tuff Tuff, Weird Science, and The Pick-Up Artist. As a result of these younger roles Downey Jr. often associated with the group known as the "Brat Pack", consisting of young actors who were deemed future stars.

In 2007 Robert Downey Jr. was cast as Tony Stark in Iron Man, the first film released as part of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. When the film was released a year later, Downey Jr. was lauded for his portrayal of billionaire Tony Stark and was said to be the best part of the entire film. From there Downey Jr. signed on to reprise his role as Tony Stark/Iron Man in three other films; two Iron Man sequels (Iron Man 2, and Iron Man 3) and The Avengers. He also had a cameo appearance in The Incredible Hulk, though only as Tony Stark.

Acting Profile

Robert Downey Jr. is a classically trained actor, he attended the Stagedoor Manor Performing Arts Training Center when he was a teenager. While his very first roles were for film, he truly got his start in theater, staring in off-Broadway musicals.

Comic Related Movie Roles

Tony Stark/Iron Man

Robert Downey Jr's most popular role was portraying billionaire inventor Tony Stark in the film Iron Man. Downey Jr. reprises his role as Stark in Iron Man 2, Iron Man 3, The Incredible Hulk (in a post-credits cameo), The Avengers and is assumed to be in Avengers 2 as well. He also appeared in the short film The Consultant.
name: Robert Downey Jr.

description:
Biography

Eva Mendes was born in Miami, Florida, on the 5th of March, 1974. The Cuban American actress is also a model, singer and designer and cites Cindy Crawford as a role model.

Acting Profile

Starting off in roles such as Children of the Corn V: Fields of Terror, Mendes would aspire to act in more serious roles, and would quickly ascend with roles in Training Day, Once Upon a Time in Mexico and We Own the Night.

Comic Related Movie Roles

Roxanne Simpson

Mendes plays the Ghost Rider supporting character Roxanne Simpson in the 2007 released Ghost Rider movie, alongside Nicholas Cage and Sam Elliott.

Sand Saref

Mendes would play Sand Saref in the 2008 film The Spirit, as the love interest of the title character the Spirit. Mendes would seek out the role approaching director Frank Miller to express interest.
name: Eva Mendes

deck: Comic writer and frontman for the band Say Anything.
description:
Biography

Max was born in New York City but his family moved out to California when he was still young. He dabbled in the movie business for a while before committing to playing music. His Jewish upbringing and personal struggles constantly find their way into his music. He has been a fan of comics since he was a child.

Max is married to Eisley frontwoman Sherri Dupree-Bemis and they have a baby girl named Lucy Jean Bemis.

Career

Music

In 2000, Max's band Say Anything released their first album Junior Varsity. This was followed up by Baseball in 2001 and the EP Majorah/Menorah in 2002. The band hit commercial success with the 2004 release of ...Is a Real Boy. The band returned with In Defense of the Genre in 2007. Their self-titled album came out in 2009 and Anarchy, My Dear was released in 2012. Max not only acts as the main song writer, but also the guitarist, keyboardist, and bassist for most tracks.

Comics

Max is bi-polar. His experiences with this disorder, coupled with his love for comic books, prompted him to approach various comic production companies to pitch various ideas. BOOM! Studios liked what they heard and asked Max to write a script for Polarity, which has now been released and chronicles the life of a boy with bi-polar disorder, as well as superhuman abilities.
name: Max Bemis

deck: Artist.
name: Emily Martin

name: Mike Lopez

deck: Artist and singer for the band Eisley.
description:
Biography

Having been exposed to music her whole life, Sherri started the band Eisley with her sisters Stacey and Chauntelle, along with her brother Wes and a neighborhood friend. Sherri has also always been an artist, designing many t-shirts and posters for the band.

She is married to Say Anything frontman and comic writer Max Bemis and they have one child, Lucy Jean Bemis.

Career

With Eisley, Sherri has released many, many EPs and three studio albums: Room Noises (2005); Combinations (2007); The Valley (2011). Their latest album Currents was released in 2013.

Sherri has recently helped with the cover art for the first issue of her husband's comic Polarity. Max has also admitted that some aspects of the character of Lily are based on Sherri.
name: Sherri DuPree Bemis

deck: Author and illustrator, Rob Harrell created the syndicated comic strip Big Top, and currently writes and draws the daily comic strip Adam@Home.
description:
Overview

Author and illustrator, Rob Harrell created, wrote, and drew the syndicated daily comic strip Big Top from 2002 through 2007. A Big Top collection was published in 2005 by Andrews McMeel Publishing. Currently, he writes and draws the long-running daily strip Adam@Home, which he took over from its creator Brian Basset in 2009. Adam@Home appears in more than 140 papers worldwide.

His all-ages graphic novel, Monster on the Hill, was released by Top Shelf Productions in 2013, to many rave reviews and accolades.

As a freelance illustrator, he has worked with clients including Mad, Simon and Schuster, American Greetings, Time, Inc. and Volkswagen. Harrell’s figurative paintings have been shown around the country, including solo shows in San Francisco, Austin and Indianapolis.

He lives in Austin, Texas with his wife, Amber and their two dogs, Cooper and Kasey.
name: Rob Harrell

description:
Comic Related Movie Roles

David Banner

Bill Bixby played the TV version of Bruce Banner: David Banner but not his alter ego the Hulk (who was played by Lou Ferrigno). His movie appearances in the role were in The Incredible Hulk, The Incredible Hulk: Death in the Family, The Incredible Hulk Returns and The Trial of the Incredible Hulk. He is also known for starring in the television show My Favorite Martian during the 1960s. He also starred in the Courtship of Eddie's Father from the early 1970s. His final works were as a director for the NBC show Blossom starring Mayim Bialik.
name: Bill Bixby
